Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a gRPC server in Go that handles various WebSocket operations including checking user online status, sending messages to users, broadcasting messages to all users, and retrieving user lists.

Struct Description: The `server` struct implements the gRPC service interface defined in the protobuf file, providing concrete implementations for WebSocket operations.

Fields:
- UnimplementedAccServerServer: [protobuf.UnimplementedAccServerServer] - Embedded type to ensure forward compatibility with gRPC service updates

Methods:
- QueryUsersOnline: [Name](ctx context.Context, req *protobuf.QueryUsersOnlineReq) -> (*protobuf.QueryUsersOnlineRsp, error) - Checks if a specified user is currently online
- SendMsg: [Name](ctx context.Context, req *protobuf.SendMsgReq) -> (*protobuf.SendMsgRsp, error) - Sends a message to a specific user
- SendMsgAll: [Name](ctx context.Context, req *protobuf.SendMsgAllReq) -> (*protobuf.SendMsgAllRsp, error) - Broadcasts a message to all connected users
- GetUserList: [Name](ctx context.Context, req *protobuf.GetUserListReq) -> (*protobuf.GetUserListRsp, error) - Retrieves the list of currently connected users
- Init: [Name]() -> () - Initializes and starts the gRPC server with configuration from Viper
